Reviews.Title: “Not as advertized”
Reviews.Author: pawprintky
Reviews.Content: When I booked this condo Vilages at Indian Point was #2 choice in Branson from TripAdvisor. Today I see that it is #4. The condo was well appointed, had sleep number beds and was very clean. No complaints on the unit except that I paid for a lake front unit. Could not even see the water. Lake was about 1/4 mile down lane with no swim dock. Condo company also advertized Free WiFi. We arrived late Saturday afternoon due to Hurricane Issac rain. It was about 4:00 when we checked in. We received pool towels, maps, attraction discont tickets etc. I did not mention internet since it was advertized that all units had Wi Fi. Late that evening when trying to get on line I discovered that there was no cordless internet. An ethernet cable was needed to connect to internet. The next am was Saturday and the office was closed. The next day was Labor Day and again the office was closed. Internet access was not just a "like to have" resource for our vacation. Our businesses depend on internet access. To say we were disappointed to sit on a balcony with no view except trees and not being able to get on the internet was extremely frustating. Actually spoiled a 3 day get away. Back to Lake of the Ozarks for us. Shephard of the Hills live show was the highlight of the trip.

Reviews.Title: “View from the Treetops”
Reviews.Author: TeakWoodDeck
Reviews.Content: Our recent stay at The Village at Indian Point again validates the usefulness of TripAdvisor reports by travelers that have gone before us. We had never been to Branson, and did not know the area or its amenities. We put our trust in TripAdvisor and picked the #1 rated hotel accommodation on the list. We were not disappointed with our choice; particularly after seeing the vast array of older motel style accommodations in the area. The Village at Indian Point is a resort of individually owned condominiums located about six miles west of the Route 76 strip in Branson. The place is a couple of miles south of Silver Dollar City, a popular theme park. We booked a two bedroom two bath unit through the resort’s website just a week before our visit. Our condo was everything we expected and was neat as a pin. Each unit is individually owned, so the décor and amenities differ slightly from unit to unit. Ours had fishing lodge décor based around the owner’s apparent interest in trout fishing. The furnishings and beds were comfortable. There was a basically equipped kitchen, with the items needed to prepare breakfast and other simple meals. Coffee maker, but no free coffee supplies; so if you think you will need something, bring it or buy it. Traveling by car, we brought a large bin of supplies from our pantry, and a large ice chest with food and drinks. Our unit in Lodge 10 was on the middle level, which was at parking lot level, so no stairs to navigate (nice!). The two bathrooms were clean and well stocked with towels, some basic toiletries and paper goods. There is no maid service during the stay, so one would need to run a load in the full size washer & dryer in the laundry room. There were three flat screen TVs with each with a DVD player, and about 60 cable channels. The Wi-Fi provided good internet access for our electronics. One of the nice features of the condo was the balcony with views of Table Rock Lake in the distance. The deck was 30’ x 12’, and this end unit had a second smaller balcony off the dining area. Our unit had a porch swing and table and chairs, and it was very pleasant and relaxing to sit outdoors. It felt like we were up in a tree house with all the green trees surrounding the unit. Our experience was quiet and peaceful, with no noisy neighbors; but I suspect noise and foot traffic could be an issue if there was a higher level of occupancy. The resort has both outdoor and indoor swimming pools which were inviting and not crowded. Overall we had a very relaxing and enjoyable stay at The Village at Indian Point a “home away from home”. Thanks to all TripAdvisors for taking the time to write these reviews. We’ll be back soon!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Place To Stay on Vacation!!”
Reviews.Author: Ucantrvl
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Bldg. # 9 top floor end unit 2 bedroom. The location of the bldg. was nice, not too far from the pool, we could walk there from the unit. Be advised, some of the bldgs. are not as close so ask first if walking would be a problem for you. Being on the Pointe was very nice as I don't think I would like to stay in town. I guess it is just what you intend to do. If you want to see shows alot of the time, then a place on the strip would be what you need. However, it was not a far drive from VIP to the Branson strip. Our condo was so cozy, all decorated like a lake lodge. It was spotless and the beds were comfortable. The kids loved it and we had such a good time. It really felt like home. The owners care very much about the upkeep of the property. We encountered no issues at all during our stay and it was very hot during the 4th week of July. The air conditioning worked fine & it was almost 100 every day! All in all, a great stay and if we are ever back in Branson, we will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: Haley M
Reviews.Content: We are from Ohio and stayed at VIP at the beginning of August. The place was wonderful and the condo we had was beautifully decorated. We loved it and hope to return. The lake was fun and the views from our balcony were priceless. There were 2 pools and our children really enjoyed swimming and we relaxed in the hot tub. Its very close to Silver Dollar City which was nice and just a short drive to the city to see all of the attractions but still private and peaceful on the lake.

Reviews.Title: “What a great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Michelle264Muncie
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our first stay in Branson. Our condo was the highlight of our trip. I could have spent the entire trip at Village at Indian Point. The condo was fully equipped with everything we could possibly need. I enjoyed the location being away from the strip and the craziness. Only drawback to our unit was being on the first floor and hearing people walking above us. Really annoying when a family was moving out and then youngsters that liked to run moved in. Other than that....it was fabulous. Paulette was very helpful with planning shows and excursions with us. We made good use of the hot tub and outdoor pool.I'm still missing being outside on the deck in the morning drinking a cup of coffee and watching the sun rise over the Ozark Mountains. I wouldn't stay anywhere else when we return.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay with family”
Reviews.Author: Carolyn S
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a stay at the Village at Indian Point. We are a family of 5 and I was concerned about staying at a hotel. We needed the extra space during downtime. We were so pleasantly surprised at the great condo. We booked one of the 2 bedroom, 2 bathroom condos. We stayed in Bldg 18 and the view of the lake was amazing. It was great to have the full kitchen and washer and dryer. I loved being able to go home with only the dirty clothes from the night before! We were able to get in and out to various locations and Branson West for some grocery shopping. My husband and I enjoyed getting up in the morning to watch the sunrise before the kids got up. All in all, we enjoyed the amenties such as DVD and board game rentals. We will definitely plan a trip back. The only negatives we experienced was the fact that we were on a middle floor and the family above us were a little noisy. You could hear a lot of foot noise and toilet flushing, etc. but that is generally expected in that sort of layout.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay without a boat!”
Reviews.Author: Brett A
Reviews.Content: Our family of 5 enjoyed our recent vacation to the Village At Indian Point-Branson. The condo was clean and had everything we needed for our 5 night stay. The game room, pools, and hot tub were also a plus for the kids. The grounds, although cramped, were well kept. It was pretty close to most everything we planned to do in Branson. We would probably only consider staying here again if we left our boat at home. First, they do not have their own boat ramp, so we had to drive to a nearby resort to use theirs. Maneuvering with the trailer was very difficult because of the narrow layout and limited trailer parking. The access to the boat dock was terrible both from the condo and the water. It was a pretty far walk on steep, gravel roads if you tried to walk to and from your condo. The narrow, shallow cove makes it quite difficult for even the most experienced boaters to pull in and out of the boat slips. We just didn't feel that the Village was very conducive to boating travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay near Silver Dollar City”
Reviews.Author: Marissa H
Reviews.Content: We booked a two-bedroom, two-bathroom condo here based on the ratings on TripAdvisor. We were not disappointed! The condo was very comfortable, and the view was amazing! We were in the treetops on our deck, looking out over mountains and the lake. It was very convenient for getting to and from Silver Dollar City (SDC). Getting to Indian Point can be difficult when hundreds of others are trying to get to SDC, but overall, the location was great. We will definitely consider staying here again when we return to Branson. The convenience of a full kitchen and the extra space was a huge advantage over a hotel room or two. The setting was gorgeous, and the staff was friendly. The only thing keeping me from giving an Excellent rating are the traffic headaches (which you'll find anywhere in Branson) and some noise from the neighboring condo and outside areas. Otherwise, it was a perfect stay in a beautiful location!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice in Branson”
Reviews.Author: snowfall1
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a building near the check in, building 19 I think, unit 8 which is a middle unit in the 3 story and our unit was excellent. It was clean, large for our family of 5, and we had a great view of table rock lake and a very nice screened porch to sit on to view that from. The staff were not the friendliest we have encountered in our travels but we had little contact other than check in and check out. We would definitely stay again. Be sure to rent a boat at the State Park Marina if you enjoy boating, even if you haven't done this before, they offer instruction on how to operate the boats and it was a highlight, also see Dogwood Canyon if you enjoy the outdoors. We never cooked in the unit, but it is nice to have that option instead of driving off property all the time to eat as there is no restaurant on the grounds. The pool was very nice, busy late in the day, but very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Branson”
Reviews.Author: Lotawana
Reviews.Content: We planned a short two day stay in Branson in conjunction with picking up our son at Kanakuk Camps. I found this place online and have to say was pleasantly surprised. Most of Branson hotels are a bit out dated and in need of a makeover. Our cabin was clean, quite big with a full kitchen, two baths, two bedrooms, and a pull out. It also had a full laundry which was quite handy since campers clothes need an immediate wash! The electronics and a bit of the decor was a bit dated in this unit but that was just fine. One bedroom actually had a flat screen. Oh yeah and the porch was really nice with full amenities including a grill. The grounds were well kept and the pool and common areas look like they were recently renovated. Indoor and outdoor pool is great in case you come in cooler weather (it was in the 100s when we were there) The only thing we would change next time would be to try to get a lake view. Great value for the money. We could have stayed week! RIGHT next to Silver Dollar City in case you are thinking about that.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Aquiles96
Reviews.Content: We took our 3 nieces here for a three night get-away. The Condo was very spacious and clean:) Our balcony overlooked Table Rock Lake. They have an indoor pool, hot tub, outdoor pool, and game room. We could find nothing to complain about!! It is very close to Silver Dollar City, and about 15 minutes away from the main strip in Branson. (Which we loved) It was a great home away from home, and I would highly recommend it to anyone!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay for the 2nd time!”
Reviews.Author: Glenda E
Reviews.Content: This is our second time staying at the Village at Indian Point. We are already planning to stay again next year, and bring the rest of family too. The condo was very clean and staff very friendly. The only complaint that we were on the second level and the people above us were up all night long. We could hear their bed squeak when they got in and out of it. Other than that, everything was GREAT!! See you next year! The Elder Family

Reviews.Title: “MISSED THE LAKE VIEW”
Reviews.Author: 682love_the_lake
Reviews.Content: My son and his family and myself stayed in a condo. Was very nice, everyone loved it...BUT 1 thing, I had specifically asked for a condo with a view "of the lake" and all we had a view of were the trees. I was really disappointed because that is a "HUGE" thing to me, the beautiful view of the lake. Otherwise it was great, we had a good time.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and great rooms!”
Reviews.Author: hendersonmom
Reviews.Content: We were thoroughly surprised at how much we liked The Village at Indian Point. Our family of four, plus my parents, stayed for four nights. TV in each room was a bonus. We were right next to the pool, which was a hit with our kids. Indoor pool, hot tub plus and outdoor pool. Most of the time the workers at the front desk were very helpful except for one who never had any restaurant recommendations or anything else to offer. You can't tell me you live in Branson and have no idea where to eat. Anyway, our room was very clean and we loved how much space there was. Plenty of room for the six of us. The grill out front was a nice feature even though we didn't use it. The bonus is the washer and dryer in the room! We had to use it since we were on a long trip. This is so close to Silver Dollar City, I'm not sure you could get any closer. The only negative was the people above us were very loud and stayed up very late each night. They stomped around, then went out onto their porch and talked loudly outside around 3:30 a.m. two nights in a row. I would have complained to the front desk, but it was the middle of the night and I was too tired. Other than that, this was a great stay and we will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Stay”
Reviews.Author: rick t
Reviews.Content: Rick T After arriving a little late, the envelope was taped to the office door with our room key inside. When we got into the room, we were excited because it was upscale. Loved the setup. The best part of course, for the children, was the 2 pools and spa. As for the essentials, the only thing we had to get was food and drinks cause the resort accommodated us with all the kitchen and bathroom essentials. We can say that this was one of the best stays ever. Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to stay, except for the beds!”
Reviews.Author: aspiringtravelcritic
Reviews.Content: Village at Indian Point is a beautiful place to stay. The kids loved the indoor AND outdoor pools and game rooms. The rooms themselves were real nice. Awesome kitchen, living room, 2 bathrooms, 2 bedrooms, washer & dryer and great deck, complete with a grill! Check in and check out was the easiest EVER! We got there after office ours and our room key with a map of the resort was taped to the door with my name on it! I was real impressed. There is absolutely NOTHING to complain about except the BEDS! This was by far the ABSOLUTE WORST BED I HAVE EVER SLEPT ON!! Both beds were the same. The linens were hard and the bed was only one step above sleeping on the floor. Although we really liked the rooms, pools and beautiful setting, we probably will not stay here again because of the beds and it's hard to enjoy your days when you don't sleep well.

Reviews.Title: “Minor annoyance outwieghed by good management”
Reviews.Author: Joe D
Reviews.Content: We just got home from a four night stay. At the outset, we were very impressed by the comfortable accommodations with all the conveniences of home (i.e. washer/dryer, dishwasher, wi-fi, large comfortable beds, flat screen TVs, etc.). The view of the lake was beautiful and a late afternoon thunderstorm was such a pleasant relief to the sweltering August heat, that we opened the door to the balcony. We did have a couple of small suggestions for the management. The provided utensils in the kitchens are hit or miss. For instance, there were several times when a pair of scissors would have been handy, but there were none available. But, we had plenty of dishes and cooking utensils. Dishwasher detergent was provided, but not laundry detergent. (available for fee at the office) Also, since there is no maid service during your stay, you need to keep things tidy on your own, which any parent of a six and two year old knows is tough. Some extra cleaning supplies would have been helpful (i.e. broom and mop, or even a Swiffer) Our largest complaint was that some of the units above and next door our condo were being renovated. The workers started every morning at 7:30. This made it especially difficult to sleep in for our vacation. I addressed it with the office and they said they would take care of it, but it only got a little quieter for one morning, returning to normal levels the following day. I'm not unrealistic. I know they couldn't just stop working. However, they shouldn't have rented that unit if they knew there would be work going on around it. The noise would have lowered my rating, had it not been for the following saving grace. During our stay, our six year old daughter was horsing around in her room and broke the leg off a decorative stool. When I went to check out, I voiced my disappointment about the construction noise and then explained the broken stool and offered to pay for its replacement. The (assumed) manager overheard the conversation and told me not to worry about the stool I offered again, but she said it was to make up for the noise problem. I was pleasantly surprised and grateful. Overall, this turned out to be a very nice place to stay and I would recommend it highly to anyone visiting Branson. On a side note, we saw three shows while we were there. TODD OLIVER AND HIS TALKING DOGS (ventriloquism act) I'd give it 2 out of 5 stars. Good concept, but needs fine tuning. BUCKETS N BOARDS (percussion comedy show) 5 stars. Very funny and enjoyable for the whole family. They are about to leave for a few months on Disney Cruises, so you can catch them there too. Finally, we saw CIRQUE MONTAGE (circus show, a la Cirque Du Soleil) 4 out of 5 stars. Had some real high points, but don't expect the large scale and quality of a Cirque du Soleil. Very talented performers, but it lacked the variety of acts. Also went to the Talking Rocks Cavern (4/5) Good fun, beautiful cave. Avoid if you are claustrophobic or afraid of heights. Ripley's Believe It or Not Odditorium (3/5) typical Ripley's museum. OK, but not the best of the others I've visited. And the Titanic museum. Very cool, but tough to get through with a two and six year old. Good trip overall.

Reviews.Title: “Great for family reunions!”
Reviews.Author: Jane F
Reviews.Content: I booked this place two years ago after my sister and her husband had a great experience with their family of 6. We brought 39 family members here for a family reunion a week ago and had a great time. First off, they have a very friendly cancellation policy and do not require an advance deposit. Second, they went to the work of creating a master list of condos and their occupants so that we could each have a copy. We also rented the meeting room for family meals and our kids were often found in the game room and in the zero entry pool. Lots of trees on the property helped offset the extreme heat and the boat slip was a short walk away. The condos were very nice although some were better stocked with kitchen items than others. Also, sizes and numbers of TVs per condo varied but all came with washer and dryers. We liked this place so much we are booking for our next reunion in two years. A definite thumbs up to be so close to the Branson action, particularly Silver Dollar City, and to have such a friendly and flexible staff.

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleasant Stay”
Reviews.Author: Jessica P
Reviews.Content: My family and I were very impressed of our condo being clean, cozy/comfortable! We loved the quiet atmosphere and the swimming pools! I would highly recommend the Village at Indian Point! We stayed four nights and wished we would have been able to stay longer! We were pleased with the Staff being friendly and all the advantages to our stay they had to offer! We will being returning in future vacations to the Village!

Reviews.Title: “More than expected!”
Reviews.Author: Jennifer B
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed for two nights at the Village at Indian Point. It was easy to find and so close to Silver Dollar City. The condo itself was very clean and more than I was expecting. Overall, a great experience!

Reviews.Title: “2 night stay at Village at Indian Point”
Reviews.Author: Deb T
Reviews.Content: My husband, daughter and I stayed for 2 nights in July. Our condo was wonderful - much more than what I had expected. Clean, beautifully decorated, and had everything in it that we needed. The pool was great too. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!!”
Reviews.Author: CiaraMarie01
Reviews.Content: We took our two kids here at had a awesome time. Our room was so nice and clean. We had the two bedroom jacuzzi suite. We didn't realize that each condo is individually owned and some owners choose to rent out their condo when not using it. Our condo had about everything we could think of in it. The kitchen was fully equipped with dishes, pans etc. We had books, games, magazines. The whole resort was beautiful and relaxing. Also if you are going to Silver Dollar City it is only maybe 5 minutes down the road.

Reviews.Title: “Family Reunion was a great success, thanks Village at Indian Point!”
Reviews.Author: TravelFun66221
Reviews.Content: Our family reserved several units for a long weekend reunion in July. Everyone was extremely happy with the accommodations, location, amenities, etc. Everything really was as presented on the web site. We appreciated the view of the lake from our unit, which wasn't the case for all. Facilities and grounds are meticulously maintained. Service from the front desk was friendly and welcoming. Thanks for a great time! I definitely recommend the Village at Indian Point!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely gorgeous! And great staff!”
Reviews.Author: heather c
Reviews.Content: My family has stayed at The Village At Indian Point five times now and we've loved every condo we've been in but this last condo was the best! Gorgeous cabin decor with a nice screened in porch (deck) and table with four chairs. Jaccuzzi is always a hit with the girls (ages 6 and 9). Beverly and Paulette are always accomodating and very kind to us. We refuse to stay anywhere else in Branson even if other properties are cheaper. You get what you pay for and staying at these condos really makes all the difference in how much you enjoy your time away from home.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous scenery!!! Loved the deck!”
Reviews.Author: mismilkmaid
Reviews.Content: Me and my daughter had a three day retreat in Branson and stayed at the Village at Indian Point and were NOT dissapointed! Gorgeous view of the lake and loved sitting on the deck morning noon and night!!! It would have been nice to have a ceiling fan out there though. We were impressed with all the amenities in our condo. We cooked, swam, and relaxed! We were so close to Silver Dollar City and missed all the traffic jams completely! Spent plenty more time at White Water and shopping as well! We will definitely stay there again!!!

Reviews.Title: “3 day mid week stay”
Reviews.Author: Sandiatthebeach
Reviews.Content: We rented two condos side by side that connected on the decks. Both were spacious, clean, nicely decorated and comfortable. The outdoor pool is a zero entry pool that our 85 year old aunt and 1 year old grand child could both get in and out of easily. The location is great. Silver Dollar city is nearby. The strip is close, especially if you use the "alternate routes". We loved the porch swing on teh deck of the lobby that overlooked the outdoor pool and lake. There is a nice indoor pool, although we didn't use it. Would love to go back NOW! Tip use the directions, given by the condo. they give coordiantes. We used then while our son in law did his own thing, We arrived a good half hour before them because we bypassed the "strip" traffic.

Reviews.Title: “Nice looking property, but the units themselves are poor quality”
Reviews.Author: Brian D
Reviews.Content: Our family of two adults and three children stayed here in July 2012. The property itself is attractive and very convenient to Silver Dollar City, and to a marina where we rented a boat and a jet ski. However we were very underwhelmed by the condo itself, especially considering its Trip Advisor rating of second best place to stay in Branson. There was a strong, unidentifiable stench in the condo that we just lived with for the four days we were there, due to our allergies to scented air fresheners. This particular unit was outdated in furnishings and appliances; everything in it was poor quality, especially the mattresses. Also, when we opened up the hide-a-bed, that mattress was dirty with hair and crumbs. The ceiling and upper level floor is poorly insulated so we heard every move our upstairs neighbors made. This made sleeping at night very frustrating as our neighbors were active and started playing loud music after midnight. My husband went to use the fitness room, and was disappointed that it only contained 3 pieces of equipment, two of which were not working. The "game room", which we were looking forward to using, contained an air hockey table that costs 75 cents per play. We hope to return to Branson as the trip itself was enjoyable, but we will not come back to the Village at Indian Point.

Reviews.Title: “Beat my expectations”
Reviews.Author: Shycke
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights in a two bedroom unit. Rustic feeling in the woods, quiet and peaceful. Comfortable beds with a country decor...what else would you expect in Branson. Not too far from the Branson strip and just down the road from Silver Dollar City. If you are looking to rent a boat, Indian Point Marina is about a half mile south of The Village. Pools are great too, one inside and one out with a small view of Tablerock Lake. Will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Niceto comfortable condos close to Table Rock Lake.”
Reviews.Author: drmolecule
Reviews.Content: Stayed in these condos for a family reunion. They are all privately owned, so some are nicer than others but all are clean and functional. We had two adjoining units. One was newly updated and cozy. The other was outdated and had a vague fishy smell. Luckily we brought air freshener and this did the trick. The pool area is nice and parking is convienient. It is close to lake activities and golfing (and all the Branson shows if you are into that). Overall, a nice place to get together if you want to be in that area.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean!”
Reviews.Author: Nikki S
Reviews.Content: Very nice property. Our condo was very clean and pet friendly. The decor was outdated and reminded me of grandmas house. The pool and spa was very nice. We will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT PLACE AND WE WILL BE GOING BACK!”
Reviews.Author: Rhonda E
Reviews.Content: Conveniently located to Silver Dollar City. Our condo was clean and tastefully decorated. The complex was beautiful and decorated for the 4th of July holiday. Lots of amenities. Staff was helpful and great. We loved it and plan on going back this summer. My only comments that are slightly negative are ....you could hear your neighbors above walking around, talking and sliding doors. Also, I work out daily early in the morning and wish the fitness center opened much earlier, so I could get my workout done before I started my day. OVERALL A FABULOUS PLACE TO STAY AND WE WILL BE GOING BACK!!!

Reviews.Title: “Family Vacation”
Reviews.Author: Paula G
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 6 nights and the staff was very friendly, condo was extremely clean and up to date. Neighbors were very nice and friendly as well. Much nicer then we expected. Only draw back was small parking not very suitable for large vehicles. Children really enjoyed the pool and it is close to SDCity.

Reviews.Title: “Bring earplugs”
Reviews.Author: Mizzsuzn
Reviews.Content: The condo we stayed in was impressive - very clean, very well kept, nice furnishings.  If the condo wasn't new, it was sure kept in like new condition.  There were a lot of little extras too that made getting organized and comfortable quite easy!  I really loved our little condo and all that was provided! It was quaint, cozy and comfortable. However, as much as I loved and enjoyed it, I am not sure I would be able to stay there again.  My complaint is, you really can hear everything your upstairs neighbor does, and I mean EVERYTHING!  We could literally trace EVERY dull-thudded step as they moved throughout the condo.  You can hear things like the opening of dresser drawers, the deck door and even them going to the bathroom  among other things. Like I said, EVERYTHING! It's like sharing your vacation with another family.  If you are there hoping to turn in early or sleep in late, you may not get to if you have an upstairs neighbor, especially one who has a small child who stomps the length of the unit, screaming.  If you are a light sleeper or sensitive to noise, request a top floor unit, otherwise  be sure to pack either earplugs, iPod and headphones, or a white noise machine and top it off with a really good sleeping aid :-)

Reviews.Title: “Great location for Silver Dollar City”
Reviews.Author: Busigrrl21
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with family (4 adults and 3 kids) in a 2-bedroom + loft condo. If you're looking for a place to stay close to Silver Dollar City, I'd highly recommend this property. You miss all the early morning traffic by coming in from the resort instead of Hwy 76. We checked in on a Monday and checked out on Wednesday in June 2012 and the resort was not crowded. We stayed in #26 on the 3rd floor and had a distance view of the lake from our deck. The condo was well equipped with cooking utensils and pots/pans for our use. We used the charcoal grill on the bottom floor for hamburgers and hotdogs one night which saved us from dining out that night. Having our own washer and dryer was fantastic, great for quick drying of the swimsuits and towels, as well as doing a load of towels for the bathrooms. The kids loved the loft area as well as the deck, great space for them to play as well as have ample space for sleeping. When we checked in, the pull out bed did not have linens, but a quick call to the front desk had that rectified. The staff was at our door within 10 minutes, great response! We did have issues with the local Dominoes pizza delivery, it's difficult to know your exact address or phone number to the condo. Considering all the advertisement in the actual condo for Dominoes, you'd think they'd know exactly who is calling and what the address is. We loved the pools and hot tub, it was so nice after a long day at SDC! The facilities were clean and well-kept. I'd recommend you bring your own beach towels for the pool if you like a bigger towel. Also, bring your own laundry detergent and dryer sheets for the washer and dryer, it may not be provided in your condo. I brought my own napkins, paper plates and cups to cut down on how many dishes need to be washed. Also, if you forget any condiments or cooking ingredients (butter for mac & cheese!), there is at least one grocery store on the way down to the resort once you've passed SDC. You won't have to go all the way back to Branson, but you will pay a premium ($2.19 per box of Kraft mac & cheese, I forgot the box at home!). Very convenient, but pricey! I'd definitely bring my family back to this resort and recommend to anyone who's looking for more space, close location to SDC or just something different from the hotel rooms in Branson.

Reviews.Title: “No Stess”
Reviews.Author: Joe G
Reviews.Content: Rented 4 units for a week long family reunion. Very close to SDC which was convenient and not too far away from Branson or Branson West for shopping. Despite picky relatives who expect these places to be better maintained/cleaned than their own homes, I found all units to be more than acceptable. A good time was had by all.

Reviews.Title: “Our favorite”
Reviews.Author: Rick C
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at The Village at Indian Point for several years now. Different condos each time and have never been disappointed. The office staff have always been more than helpful in finding ways to fill our needs. Outstanding is a rating I rarely use, however, this resort sets the standard.

Reviews.Title: “Way nicer than we expected!”
Reviews.Author: Terra R
Reviews.Content: I found these condos on tripadvisor. The condo was absolutely beautiful! We stayed in Lodge 17, Unit 5. Beautiful decor, AWESOME Jacuzzi tubs and fabulous deck with a view of Tablerock Lake. We had a two bedroom lakefront...Paulette said they were the newest condos without any condos between us and the lake. You are still about 100 yards from the lake...a woody slope between the condo and the lake. The deck was very private, but you could hear the people above you. Only complaint is that there was a lot of noise from our neighbors beside and above us. Fortunately they were not there the whole time that we were! The jacuzzi in the master suite is huge, and perfect after a long day at Silver Dollar City! I could not get the WiFi to work on my Kindle Fire. Loved it, and will definitely go back!

Reviews.Title: “Vacation Stay”
Reviews.Author: Teresa S
Reviews.Content: Would definitely stay here again! Condo was beyond expectation just a short distance from Silver Dollar City. Kids loved the loft area and we really enjoyed the deck and lake view. People were very friendly and the whole experience was very pleasant. Loved the clean and peaceful atmosphere around the lodge. Will plan to come her again.

Reviews.Title: “Great place!”
Reviews.Author: Brandy1033
Reviews.Content: This is our second time to stay here, and by far my favorite. Lodge was very clean with all the amenities you would need. Perfect spot that overlooked the lake. The pool area was very neat and clean. Nice place to stay at if you want to relax and spend some time away from the strip. Silver Dollar City is right up the road and easy to get to. Feels like "home", with fireplace, dining table, washer & dryer, etc. Better than you advertised. Can't wait to come back :)

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: Sooner064
Reviews.Content: If you want to relax and get away from the strip, this is by far the best place to stay. Our room was very clean and nicely decorated with all the amenities you could ask for. Flat screen tv in the living room and all bedrooms, full kitchen and the deck overlooked the lake. The view was great! The staff was friendly and helpful. The pool was very nice and clean. We will definately stay here again and I would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Our Stay at VIP”
Reviews.Author: JR L
Reviews.Content: Absolutely the best place to stay! Close to the Marina, Silver Dollar City, and just minutes from Branson proper. Very, very, very clean! Great ammeneties- real wood burning fireplace, full kitchen, and great deck. Great views. Super comfortable. Better than advertised. We had a boat in Branson. Rented a boat and fished/tubing on the lake; took in a show IT- must see; Zip Lined at Wolfe Creek; and had fun at the TRACK. Our kids are 9 and 13 and we truly enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Our stay at the Village at Indian Point”
Reviews.Author: TYSGUY
Reviews.Content: Very nice place to stay while in Branson. This was our second time to stay there and is by far the nicest place we have stayed at in all our times in Branson. Silver Dollar City is right up the street and easy to get to. The units are clean and well furnsished with large patios. Our kids love the indoor and new outdoor pool and the view is great. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Close to Silver Dollar City”
Reviews.Author: Nan_ok_12
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Condo 12/12 which was very clean. Kitchen was well stocked. It had games and books for the kids. The towels were very thin and small and it is your responsibility to wash them---wish they had a towel service like some places. I ended up buying additional wash cloths for us. Our deck had nice furniture, but had several nails sticking up and I worried about the granddaughters stepping on them without shoes. Also the people in the condo below us set out on their deck and smoked all the time so we could not use ours that much. We could never get the WIFI to work. We got up early and left for Silver Dollar City and got back after 5:00 pm so never saw anyone in the office. We did have a view of the lake but could not get to the lake without driving and never saw where the kids could fish. The pool was clean and the kids enjoyed it. It was a relaxing place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Condo "near" Table Rock Lake”
Reviews.Author: Christina S
Reviews.Content: We truly enjoyed our stay at the Village at Indian Point Condos. Our Unit 1 condo was beautiful. We had 2 bedrooms, a fold out couch, a nice kitchenette, 3 tv's and a whirlpool tub. The patio was peaceful and private. I especially enjoyed sitting out on the patio and drinking coffee in the mornings & champagne at night. We had a beautiful view of the tree tops and the stars at night and the sunrise in the morning. There were convenient amenities - including outdoor pool, indoor pool, hot tub, game room, dvd rentals and a nice walking path. We were located close to the lake where we went boating but couldn't see the lake from our unit. Our unit had many of the utensils we needed (except for a pizza cutter). It was so convenient having a washer and dryer in our unit after swimming in the pool. Our corner unit didn't have a grill directly in front of it so we had to sit in front of the unit next to ours in order to bbq. Our beds were comfortable but the fold out couch was as thin as paper so our child's friend found that sleeping on the couch was more comfortable. We were able to totally relax on this vacation in a quiet, peaceful atmosphere. We will definately come back and highly recommend staying at this resort!!!

Reviews.Title: “Close to Silver Dollar City and Table Rock Lake”
Reviews.Author: 99Stitch
Reviews.Content: Glad we stayed at V.I.P. It is so close to Silver Dollar City which was nice after a long day at the park. The pools were nice and clean. The arcade has a pool table that my son liked. Our condo was large and well maintained. The only problem was the view outside our condo. A dumpster and truck was parked in a wooded area and we were able to see it . It took away from the nice lake view that was there.

Reviews.Title: “family vacation of 5”
Reviews.Author: Jessica Q
Reviews.Content: Great location and beautiful area and scenery, Very quiet, peaceful and relaxing atmosphere! Will definitely will be staying here again!!

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: Angela T
Reviews.Content: I've traveled to a number of places. My expectations are also pretty high. I can honestly say that the photos and reviews do these condos no justice. The condo was extremely clean! I didn't question using the comforter, walking barefoot, or filling the jacuzzi. Which I never do! It was very large, with a loaded kitchen ready for a large family to do some in depth cooking. Don't eat out! In every decorative trunk or box was movies and toys. Believe it or not, the children didn't even want to leave. I had to say three times, It's White Water time! Imagine that. The deck was spacious and very clean and cozy. Multiple seating selections. The decor was very log cabin esc with a womans touch, which was a nice escape. I enjoy trying new places, but it is safe to say that when I'm in Branson, building 17 condo 4 is going to be where I go without a doubt. Hope this helps your choice!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: 260Misty
Reviews.Content: This place is amazing. Went for a family vacation and this was perfect. It's close to Silver Dollar City and not too far from the main Branson area. We had young kids and they loved it. The pools were nice (a little cool but not bad for the time of year). The condos were clean and just perfect. I definately recommend this place and the price was better than some of the others in town.

Reviews.Title: “Make your reservations now, hate to leave in the am 7 nights too short”
Reviews.Author: sussub4
Reviews.Content: We have traveled all over. This resort is first class. Paulette, and Vicky are so helpful. The condo feels like your in your own log cabin. Everything you need is provided except food. I love this area because it is pet friendly. Pet friendly condo's are on the lowest level, which traveling with my 77 yr. old mom was great. I can't say enough about this place. We definitely will come back.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful!!”
Reviews.Author: andgin
Reviews.Content: I have no clue where the person who wrote before me that bashed this place was at but he sure didn't have the right place because first of all there is no restaurant and second there is no life guard so he must have stayed somewhere else..We stayed the week of May 28th and it was absolutely beautiful. The condo was beautifully decorated. The views were amazing. Both pools were awesome. This place is so peaceful. We had a wonderful time. Loved, loved, loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Great! Great! Great!”
Reviews.Author: 60sTravelers0120
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful few days at the Village at Indian Point. Our pet-friendly condo far exceeded our expectations. It was well furnished with leather sofa's and beautiful furniture. The decor made you feel right at home. The patio had a large outdoor sofa, patio table and four chairs. We were able to grill our fish we caught at the lake right on the electric grill provided on the patio. The patio was so comfortable and quite I was able to take a long nap. Even though we did not have a view of the lake, I would highly recommend condo 2 in building 20. Everything was provided to make our stay enjoyable. The grandkids enjoyed both the outdoor pool, indoor pool and fishing off the pier at the lake.

Reviews.Title: “May 2012”
Reviews.Author: jessica s
Reviews.Content: We were staying in a pet-friendly condo unit that had a below-grade entry... either down a flight of stairs or a steep decline. It was very nice to be able to stay in a pet-friendly community. Our unit was nice, but did not have the "homey" feeling as described. Our unit felt more like an average hotel room than a $200+ per night condo unit. We didn't have a view of the lake, but the view that we did have was beautiful. The location was nice so that we were not on the main strip of Branson, but we did have to travel on it to get anywhere. The beds in our 2bedroom unit were very, very bouncy and had cheap hotel linens on them. The furniture and decor was quite dated. The jacuzzi tub had draining issues and so we did not use it for fear it wouldn't drain properly. The front desk staff was not welcoming at all. The unit above us was easy to hear... foot steps, the toilet flushing, the sliding doors opening/shutting, etc. Overall, it did not have the private setting we were hoping for. Most likely, we will not be back at this location the next time we are in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful family vacation!”
Reviews.Author: Paula A
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a few days while on a family vacation. After we arrived, we loved it so much we decided to stay an extra day. We were in 3 consecutive condos (two adjoining) which was perfect for us. We were all impressed with how clean everything was, and the views and the surroundings are wonderful. We even recommended it to people we met at Silver Dollar City who are coming later with a family group. Anyway, it's been one of our very favorite places we've stayed anywhere.The staff was friendly and helpful too. We will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Trip to Silver Dollar CIty and stay at Village Indian Point”
Reviews.Author: pipefitterup
Reviews.Content: It was a very good Trip. The Village was a very nice place to stay. Just up the road from Silver Dollar city. The rooms have everything you need to cook or you can go out. About 15 minutes from Branson where all alot of the nice eating places are. I will tell everyone that Village at Indian Point is a very nice place to stay on Table Rock Lake. I will stay there when I go back to Branson in the summer or fall. We TOOK 2 ADULTS AND THREE KIDS. Very nice time.

Reviews.Title: “MUST MUST MUST see this place!!”
Reviews.Author: chris_thompson98
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at VIP 4 times now and just have to let everyone know how amazing this place is. Let me start by saying I have been going to branson since I was 3 years old. Now much older then that we have stayed in MANY places. This one is hands down the best I have stayed. We request the same room every time and it is allways clean, kitchen is stocked up, beds are nice, decor is top knotch. We travel with 5 ppl, The wife, 2 year old, Mom, Dad and myself. The rooms are spacious for everything we drag along. Bedrooms are nice and has 2 king sized beds, bathrooms are 5 star with 2 whiprool tubs. The back deck is screened in, ( MUST GET THIS) Its so nice to sit out on the deck and eat supper with no bugs. Just you, food and fresh air. The pools are fantastic as well. The outdoor pool is great for my 2 year old since its a 0 entry pool. he can run and splash around without worring about him getting to deep. The indoor pool is also nice for when we make our christmas trips. All in all we went through about 10 years of bouncing around from place to place to see them all. I will never stay anywhere else anymore. We have our next trip comming up in a few months angain and I love not having the stress of worring about what place your getting. Its almost like a second home to us now. And yes we have stayed at all of the big ones, Chatteau, Big cedar, Stillwaters. This one for value, upkeep, and just makeing you feel like your home is by far #1. Once again hands down best place we have stayed out of around 20 diff places in branson. My best tip to give is GET screened in porch. But after that just enjoy your stay. The pools are allways nice!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great condo, great view!”
Reviews.Author: NikiD527
Reviews.Content: We always stay at the Village at Indian Point when we go to Branson, and are never disappointed. The front office is so helpful and their condos are top notch. Will definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Better than a suite”
Reviews.Author: Craig H
Reviews.Content: Had a 2 night stay last week. The condo that we stayed in was immaculate. It was very clean an big enough to make you feel at home. It had all of the eminities, full kitchen, refirigerator, stove, BBQ Grill on the porch. Very nice to help you out when you get tired of eating out every night. It is very close to Silver Dollar City, yet within easy driving distance to Branson and all of the shows and other venues. It also has a HUGE indoor jacuzzi that works wonders on those sore legs after spending all day on your feet. We loved it here

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon of our Dreams”
Reviews.Author: THutch0424
Reviews.Content: We loved our condo we stayed in at Indian Point. We had a two night stay in building 12. We couldnt have asked for a nicer place to stay w/such a spectacular lakeside view. Gorgeous!! The condo was super clean, well equipped and decorated Beautifully. We will be back here, everytime we visit Branson..

Reviews.Title: “Great Weekend Getaway”
Reviews.Author: KarenFielderDennis
Reviews.Content: Our two bedroom unit with a loft was perfect for my husband and me and two of our children and their spouses. We each had our own space, but were all under the same roof. We loved the fact that there was a full size kitchen and a great covered deck with a porch swing overlooking the lake. The location can't be beat . . . only a few minutes to the entrance of Silver Dollar City. The unit was clean and equipped with everything we needed. The entire complex is welll-run and immaculate and the amenities are superb. When we return to Branson we will definitely stay at the Village at Indian Point.

Reviews.Title: “We didn't get what we were told...a little deceptive? I hope you read this if you plan to stay...”
Reviews.Author: Keylimeone
Reviews.Content: Let me start by saying that we made it very clear to the property manager(s) that we were traveling with my 97 year old Mom, we needed a low floor with easy access, pet friendly and some kind of Lake view. We were assigned Building 6, Unit 3, either walking down a below grade sidewalk and 9 steps or a even steeper below grade sidewalk. Upon entering the unit it appeared to be clean. As always I walked through and noticed the carpet being dirty in areas. The paint chipped and scratched walls and woodwork lead me to believe that the unit could stand a GOOD going over. The Weber Grill had a grate that was so rusted we didn't want to use it. The kitchen was poorly stocked with only 1 wine glass, the rest being plastic. Some of the dishes were chipped. If I'm paying what I was paying per night I would at least expected a better equipped kitchen, but all in all it seems minor to the overall general appearance and comfort of the Unit. The rooms were a decent size, that is the ONLY reason I gave ROOMS a three rating. The mattress were thin and not comfortable at all. I pulled hairs off of the bed sheets. Where was my Lysol? The TV in the main room was located in such a way that it blocked a part of the fireplace. So okay, we called the front desk, they were gone for the evening so we left a message. The following day we found several dead bugs and spiders in the unit. I took pictures. I went to the front desk. I voiced my concerns and was told that the Unit I was supposed to get had issues and they could not get it done in time. I was never told this prior to my arrival or upon my arrival. We were offered another Unit and went to look at it. It was not worth the move. It seems ironic to me that the information sheet mentions that this is "someone's" home and to treat it as such. If this were my home I would make sure it was in better, clean and more up to date shape. The Fitness Center consisted of one elliptical machine that made the most terrible noise, the treadmill worked but not the best at all. The outdoor pool had visible dirt, with leaves, something that looked like bird droppings...but it looks nice...the indoor pool cloudy. I am intrigued by the high ratings that this property was given. I chose this property based on what I had read. I've made my decidions based on Tripadvisor. I was let down this time.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Branson Experience”
Reviews.Author: DeeDee N
Reviews.Content: Loved the location close to Silver Dollar City! Loved that we didn't have to go into the busy part of Branson except for the one show we saw. The indoor pool and hot tub were very nice and clean, and my kids loved the game room. Our room was clean and quiet and had plenty of space for us and all our children. We would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “The perfect place to stay on a Branson Getaway!!”
Reviews.Author: Mikewurks37
Reviews.Content: Everything about this place is great. Short drive from Branson. The rooms were just what we expected. We're staying here everytime we come back to Branson.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: SinvebBabe
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Village at Indian Point for two nights over Easter weekend. We stayed in a two bedroom with jacuzzi tub and LOVED it. We have two young boys (both less than 5 years old) so they had their own bedroom to share plus my husband and I had our space. I wish we could have stayed longer as we didn't have time to enjoy the pool. The condo was nicely furnished and felt like home for the time we were there. We will definitely stay there again and would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Fun in the Ozarks”
Reviews.Author: BradLasVegas
Reviews.Content: This is our third stay at the Village at Indian Point. We love the location, and the views of the lake are fantastic. The units have everything you need: microwave, toaster, pots and pans, dishes, and washer/dryer. Wonderful bath amenities are also provided. Paulette, Beverly, and Molly are always friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: Tracey B
Reviews.Content: we had a one bedroom condo with jucuzzi tub, we took our two boys and had plenty of room, although sofa bed was not to comfortable for them, so they preferred to sleep on the floor, but they do that at home, the room was very clean and attractive, we will for sure stay again, and staff was very nice, especially Paulette.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent! The BEST Place to Stay!!”
Reviews.Author: GloverHolly
Reviews.Content: We took our kids (Ages 14, 13, 7) for a Spring Break vacation. We found this place highly recommended through TripAdvisor, and it was PERFECT!!! Beautiful location and close to downtown Branson and Silver Dollar City! Everything was clean, nicely furnished, and ready to go! Could not ask for a better place to stay! The lady at the front desk was helpful and even allowed us to check in early! We will stay at the Village at Indian Point EVERY time we are in the area! FANTASTIC!

Reviews.Title: “Love this place!”
Reviews.Author: Allen W
Reviews.Content: We stayed here during spring break. Our two little ones loved the condo and the indoor pool. Every area of the facility we saw was clean and well-kept. The condo was well-furnished with everything we needed. Great views and location. Greate for a family vacation. The staff was able to accomodate some last minute changes in our travel plans. They were great! We had fun and hope we can return in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Place with a Great View of the Lake”
Reviews.Author: Steve74017
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on spring break with our granddaughter and her friend. The two bedroom condos nearest the lake are beautiful with very nice furnishings and all the cookwear you can ever use. The large screened in balcony has an electric grill so you can cook out and a table and chairs where you can eat if you want. The people at the front desk are very helpful and they give you the best prices for any of the shows you want to see. We chose this place based on the good reviews on this website and we were not dissapointed. We would recommend this to anyone looking for a nice place to stay. It is on the same road as Silver Dollar City and only about 10 minutes from the strip. We will stay here the next time we visit Branson.

Reviews.Title: “Spring Break With The Family”
Reviews.Author: Larry H
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a good place to spend spring break with our kids in Branson… and we found it! Great rooms, secluded location and amenities close by. I could not have asked for a better location to spend spring break with my family. I will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Aubrey W
Reviews.Content: We visited Branson and stayed at the Village at Indian Point as part of a package deal. I didn't realize this would be the best part of our trip. We had a lake view from our room and patio and thoroughly enjoyed every minute of our stay. The staff was very helpful and we had no complaints. The indoor pool and hot tub was very nice also. We plan to return to Branson soon and we'll stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: Kent D
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have stayed at Indian Point several times. We brought some friends on this trip and they loved the room and setting. The rooms have a wonderful rustic flair and the area is so peaceful. We had the windows open overlooking the lake and we could hear the birds singing early in the morning and the evening. There are enough amentities that you never feel the need to leave.

Reviews.Title: “As usual a great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Holly P
Reviews.Content: I have been staying here for the last 7 years and it continues to grow and improve. The staff is always kind and helpful. Thank you for creating a fun home away from home.

Reviews.Title: “Sleeping with the bears!”
Reviews.Author: elaine m
Reviews.Content: Our unit was very welcoming with lodge decor. Bears, & birds was the theme throughout this adorable, clean, comfortable unit. Great view.

Reviews.Title: “Girls weekend”
Reviews.Author: Nicole M
Reviews.Content: I want to thank you for a very relaxing weekend. We had a great time and your condo was very comfortable. We had a nice view of the lake and were very impressed. Keep up the good work.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect weekend get away”
Reviews.Author: stlstaceyv
Reviews.Content: Our family rented two condo and went from Friday to Monday. Both condos were very clean with nice size kitchens and bathrooms (the jacuzzi tub was.great). They also had a connecting deck that worked out great. We had kids with us so we spent a lot of time at the indoor pool and hot tub, both were perfect for the kids. It was a great weekend get away.

Reviews.Title: “Everyone can't be wrong! This place is what everyone says it is.”
Reviews.Author: rbjazzman
Reviews.Content: I can't say anymore than what everyone else said about this place. One word...PERFECT !!

Reviews.Title: “Thanksgiving Get Away”
Reviews.Author: SwtAngeliz
Reviews.Content: We spent Thanksgiving day with family in Joplin, Mo. then drove to Branson to check into Indian Point. Check in was a breeze as staff left our room key and information for followup check in taped to the office door. Parking was good, no long haul of stuff late at night. I was EXTREMELY pleased with our condo. It was a 2 bedroom lake view with fireplace decorated in Eddie Bouer Styling, just beautiful. My daughter was excited to have her own bedroom and bath as she usually sleeps on the sofa bed and shares bathroom time with us. The condo was immaculate and well maintained. Kudos to the owners for their care. There was Deer Run or Creek, don't recall grocery mart and bar/grill around the corner, only place open late after the shows start it seems. I wish fees were less, but it was a nice place to spend our holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Fun Time in Branson”
Reviews.Author: Hookemhorns4444
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at Indian Point while visiting Branson. We had a beautiful view of the lake and enjoyed that the condo was close enough to Branson to see the shows, but far away enough to relax. The location was very convenient for our visit to Silver Dollar City. The condo was nice and was a good layout for our family of 4. The office staff were extremely nice and helpful. The only thing we didn't like were the towels were a little small and thin and we wish the paper products (toilet paper, bath tissues, etc) were a little softer. Other than, we thoroughly enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Peaceful!”
Reviews.Author: Bonnie F
Reviews.Content: Our stay at Village At Indian Point was wonderful. We did not have a lakeview, but still was really nice. All the comforts of home, the only thing that we didn't like was the mattress pad on our bed. It was plastic covered, was not to comfy. The unit we stayed in could use new sheets and no plastic mattress cover. We were in Lodge #9, unit 1. Everything else was awesome!!

Reviews.Title: “great stay, great place”
Reviews.Author: protectyourself
Reviews.Content: very nice, very clean, very beautfil. Could not ask for more, stayed there on new years eve.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: hounds20
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Bldg.11 Room 5. King bed, jacuzzi tub,sofa bed and fireplace. The kitchen was stocked with everything we needed. Really enjoyed the fireplace with firewood provided at no cost. Pauletta at the front desk was very nice. She made reservations for a show for us. Daughter enjoyed the indoor pool. Everything was in good condition. The grounds and condo were very clean.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place!”
Reviews.Author: Bryan C
Reviews.Content: Fantastic condo unit (building 17, unit 2) and facilities! Front desk and staff were excellent. Our children loved the beautiful pool and game room. The battery on our minivan died prior to check out as one of our children likely left one of the interior lights on. Within five minutes of speaking with the front desk, they dispatched someone to give us a jump start. We knew prior to arrival that this was the #1 rated property in Branson per Trip Advisor. Our experience exceeded expectations and we hope to visit again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great Christmas Getaway!”
Reviews.Author: Cooksonmom
Reviews.Content: Our family of 5 stayed in building 5, condo 9, a two bedroom, 2 bath and it was fabulous! This was our first visit to the Village at Indian Point and we will definitely be back. We had plenty of room. The deck was huge and had an electric grill where we grilled hot dogs and enjoyed the view. The weather was perfect for a fire and we had everything we needed to enjoy the woodburning fireplace. We especially appreciated the wood carrier and the well stocked split wood close to our condo. The staff was helpful and friendly and offered us a list of places open on the 24th and 25th as many places were not open those days. This is our new "go to" home in Branson! PS...the price was very afforable too!!

Reviews.Title: “Christmas Time In Branson w/Family”
Reviews.Author: Michelle W
Reviews.Content: We spent Christmas in this beautiful condo with an awesome view (3rd floor is the way to go). The furnishings and layout was great with an open living area and huge balcony. Condo 18/9 was decorated beautifully for Christmas with a gift under the tree for each family. It is easy to find yet off the beaten path from the hustle and bustle of "the strip". The indoor pool/jacuzzi/sauna was large and perfect for the cold nights. The only negative comment that we can be mentioned is the paper thin walls!! We could hear our neighbors below and they could hear us:(

Reviews.Title: “December Fun!”
Reviews.Author: K8T49
Reviews.Content: The weather was unseasonably cold but the condo was cozy with its delightful fireplace and decorated Christmas trees! We shopped, saw a show and spent time enjoying the holiday lights at Silver Dollar City. We will be back!!!

Reviews.Title: “Thanksgiving Weekend”
Reviews.Author: jane l
Reviews.Content: Wow! We shared our condo with our daughter and son-in-law. It was our first visit. We loved coming home to such a confortable, beautiful setting after a hard day of Christmas shopping, sight seeing, eating, and shows. The condo was so clean and we loved the good beds, nice decorations, and a kitchen that had everything you could want or need. No more motels when you can come home to Village at Indian Hills. I took lots of pictures of the condo and lodge to show our friends. Thanks to all the staff who made our stay a great memory.

Reviews.Title: “Would be great if they enforced the NO PETS policy we slept next door to dogs who could be heard thru the walls at night”
Reviews.Author: BigBransonTravelers
Reviews.Content: Not sure whose responsibility it was to clean the unit, stressed me that it wasn't clearly stated in the pamplet given upon arrival or anywhere prior to arriving. I'm not sure so I washed the bed sheets!!, Yes on my VACATION! The staff was friendly and helpful and it's located in a great place. Very disappointed w the basketball area! I mean really?, how do you play with a vehicle parked in front of the goal and it's on a slant!!!But I guess for allowing our family to stay all in one area it was worth the trouble.

Reviews.Title: “Branson Thanksgiving”
Reviews.Author: John S
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at the Village and we enjoyed it just as much as the first time. This was our first time in Branson for Thanksgiving, but we are thinking about making it an annual family trip. The condo was great for our family of four and we had everything we needed to make Thanksgiving dinner. The convenience to Silver Dollar City is a plus since we all enjoy the Christmas Festival. I would recommend this condo for any family looking for a clean, comfortable place to stay while enjoying the activities of Branson.

Reviews.Title: “THANKSGIVING WEEKEND”
Reviews.Author: Peare57
Reviews.Content: Our Thanksgiving dinner was spent in the condo at the Village at Indian Point with our family. It was very nice and comfy. We had 2 condos and the patios were adjoining so we could go back and forth. This place is super nice and clean. Ladies at the desk were very nice and helpful. Condos were very nicely decorated and very clean. They do a good job at keeping the place up. Thanks for making our trip and enjoyable one.

Reviews.Title: “Happy Thanksgiving!!”
Reviews.Author: TOKmom
Reviews.Content: We spend every Thanksgiving in Branson and this is at least our 3rd stay at Village. We absolutely love it here. We upgraded to a jacuzzi room this time and had a very updated and clean condo with KING size beds and televisions in both bedrooms! The staff is always very helpful and very friendly...we will stay again! This has become our tradition and our favorite place to stay any time we come to Branson for a weekend or for a whole week. It is close to Silver Dollar City and you can slip in and out without sitting in all the traffic.

Reviews.Title: “Favorite Condo Ever”
Reviews.Author: Ken L
Reviews.Content: We visit two to three times per year for 4-5 days at a time and have stayed here for six years. It's three generations staying--grandparents, parents and two children, and we all love it. We've stayed at four different condos on this property and have settled on one that suits us perfectly. Each condo is beautifully furnished; the kitchen is fully stocked. The grandkids love the pool, hot tub and arcade. The adults love the wood fireplace (the wood is free and there's already some on the balcony for us). We do Silver Dollar City for most of our stay, and there is no better place to stay while enjoying the City. The staff is helpful and they have thought of everything by the time we arrive. We've looked at other places, but like the Village to much to leave!

Reviews.Title: “Another great weekend at the Village at Indian Point”
Reviews.Author: Portcall25
Reviews.Content: We just spent another wonderful at the Village. Our family had 3 condos. All were very clean and tastefully decorated. Having the indoor pool is a major plus since we had 6 grandchildren with us. The outdoor pool looks great also, but we have not had a chance to use it yet. Their rates are consistent, and I would recommend reserving by phone because with the online reservations you will be charged the entire fee when you book.

Reviews.Title: “Best condo in Branson”
Reviews.Author: Jen S
Reviews.Content: Wonderful, clean place to stay for a weekend or extended stay! I love that the kitchen is fully furnished and you have to bring nothing but food. As a family spending the weekend, we used the pool almost every day and it was clean and never too busy. Excellent location - close to Silver Dollar City. We will be staying there again for our next trip to Branson.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet and Convenient”
Reviews.Author: rebel39440
Reviews.Content: Our corner two bedroom /two bath on the top floor was ideal. Clean and very quiet !!! Corner fireplace worked well and took the chill off the cool Ozark nights. We enjoyed escaping the traffic of Branson. Paulette was extremely helpful in suggesting shows and obtaining tickets for us. Excellent value and wonderful experience.

Reviews.Title: “WOW!”
Reviews.Author: MoFamTrav
Reviews.Content: This place is amazing. Great views and the rooms are breath-taking! Wood burning fireplace with free wood provided. Our balcony was screened so we didn't have to fight the bugs while sitting outside enjoying the sunrise over the lake. Will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “An oasis in the woods!!”
Reviews.Author: Barbi Y
Reviews.Content: We love this condo in Branson. We always stay here because it is clean, and the people are friendly and helpful. Many of the rooms are decorated as a log cabin might be and kitchen is organized and stocked with anything you might need to cook a little or a lot. It is very convenient to Silver Dollar City and just a few miles outside of town. Highyl recommend this place!! One more thing, each condo has a wood burning fireplace and they provide the wood for you!! Great for cold evenings with the family!!

Reviews.Title: “Grammy's Treehouse”
Reviews.Author: LaRena M
Reviews.Content: We love to stay here. We started coming to the lodge several years ago. Our entire family loves it! We send our pastor here every year for pastor appreciation, they love to just stay at the lodge and not go anywhere. Our 3 year old grandaughter started calling it Grammy's treehouse, I guess because of all the trees. Our favorite place to go is Silver Dollar City and this is just so close. It is a beautiful place to stay. We don't want to stay anywhere else. We have also rented several condo's at once and had a family Christmas stay. I can't say enough about how much we love it.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice condo- great location”
Reviews.Author: mhgd
Reviews.Content: We travelled to Branson for the first time and were pleasantly surprised to find such nice accommodations. Our 1 bedroom condo was very nice with a balcony that provided a great view of the lake. Very well decorated and furnished with many extras. We also enjoyed the indoor pool and hot tub. We will definitely keep this is mind the next time we travel to the area.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice accomodations - beautiful location”
Reviews.Author: nanaguide
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for 2 nights. I had always wanted to stay there and we weren't disappointed. The check-in staff was very friendly. Our 2 bedroom condo was ideal - can tell it is privately owned. Nice views and the kitchen had everything we needed. Hubby would have liked to have had packets of coffee for the coffee maker but they did have them for sale at the office. We would stay there again. The leaves were beautiful and we enjoyed the fireplace - nice that they provide the wood.

Reviews.Title: “Home Away From Home”
Reviews.Author: JandCOklahoma
Reviews.Content: A co-worker of mine recommended this place. We spent Labor Day weekend 2010 & Halloween weekend 2011 with a couple of good friends here. We really enjoy the motorcycle ride from a neighboring state, the view from the deck, the peacefulness of the area, & the excellent accomodations, including a homey decord & kitchen that has absolutely everything we need. We have plans to come back every year, about this time, when the leaves on the tree are turning a riot of color & it's just cold enough to throw a couple of logs in the fireplace at night.

Reviews.Title: “Great Getaway at a Decent Price”
Reviews.Author: Darin T
Reviews.Content: I found this online, and though the price wasn't a huge draw, I was able to get 2 bedrooms for a price only about 25-30% higher than an average hotel room for four. The accommodations were clean and comfortable; the unit we rented was obviously a privately owned one and appeared to be in good shape. The location was great; it was close to Silver Dollar City, and Branson West offered plenty of eating options without traveling back into Branson. I highly recommend the Mexican restaurant in Branson West, "Tequila..." something or other I think. The pool and hottub area were quaint and very up-to-date, yet they were not extremely large. For the middle of October, crowds were not a concern in the pool areas, but they do have an indoor pool as well. If I had any complaint at all, it would be the visitors above our unit; the floors are not too thick, nor do they have much sound dampening quality, so footsteps were noticable at bedtime and prior to my desired wake-up time. I think there might have been some horses up there. We will likely return.

Reviews.Title: “Practically perfect.”
Reviews.Author: Joanne C
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a 2 bedroom/2 bathroom condo in building 18. Everything was wonderful. It was immaculately clean and fairly large. Both balconies had lovely views of the lake. We did a little cooking and we had everything we needed. The staff was very accomodating from the start with the reservation process and booking shows for us. The ride into Branson was only about 10-15 minutes, and far better than staying right on the strip. The show 'SIX' is fabulous! Be sure to leave plenty of time for dinner in town before a show as many shows start at 8PM and everyone wants to eat before dinner!

Reviews.Title: “Best Condos in Branson”
Reviews.Author: Matt B
Reviews.Content: We have stayed many places and these condos are by far the best in Branson, we were in Lodge 17 Condo 5 for our last visit this past week. Had excellent decor and furnishings that gave it that rustic mountain lodge feel, and a fantastic view of the lake from the huge deck that had comfortable padded outside furniture and patio tables with plenty of seating. Not to mention the enormous jetted tub in the master bath and steam shower with 28 jets in the guest bath. The bonus for us, which is why we primarily chose these condos, was the newer indoor pool with kiddie pool, hot tub, sauna, fitness center & game room. With young kids (2 & 6 years old), having an indoor pool for our fall/winter Branson visits was a must. We will be returning to The Village at Indian Point for our next stay there in three weeks for our families annual Old Time Christmas trip, and are already looking forward to coming back. The only negatives were the sound proofing/accoustics seemed to be very poor, as we were kept awake hearing the people walk around above us and could hear conversations from adjoining condos and the tvs as well. The beds in this particular condo are a little hard as well, but nothing too terrible. Staying on the third floor in the future might help with the noise factor.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: rhlkh
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights, had a very well furnished condo, more than most. The owners were very generous with the amenities. It was decorated very tastefully. The view was beautiful. Loved having internet available. The pool was nice. We had two decks, one large one that faced the lake and a small one that seated two, perfect for morning coffee. Location is perfect for going to Silver Dollar City. We had a two bedroom with loft. We had to utilize the sleeper sofa which was not quite as comfortable as it could have been, but managed fine. We would definitely highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic getaway...Lodge 11, Unit 1”
Reviews.Author: sofun2fly
Reviews.Content: What a fantastic vacation spot! We've stayed at other locations but this was by far the best. The condo was beautiful, relaxing and convenient; offering indoor/outdoor swimming pool, game room & exercise facility, free firewood, complimentary high speed internet access, movie rentals, etc. The best part is the convenient location, so many attractions within minutes; we went back to the condo for lunch from Silver Dollar City to save $$$ on food and let the kiddo's rest a little. Located on Tablerock lake, close to Indian Point zip line, Silver Dollar City, etc. The staff was wonderful, they were very helpful suggesting attractions to see, providing discounts and they can sell tickets to many of the attractions to avoid lines. Our unit was on the end and had a little more space and 2 decks instead of 1; we even saw deer right from our deck in the morning. We will definitely come back. Check out the Village at Indian Point and ask for Lodge 11, Unit 1, you won't be disappointed...

Reviews.Title: “Perfect vacation spot!”
Reviews.Author: Darrell and Lin... M
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful resort. Very high class. Our condo was supurb. It was immaculate and the furnishings were gorgeous. We woke up to the most beautiful view from our bedroom every morning. We had a lovely deck and the furnishings were perfect. We watched the eagles soar over the lake every morning while we ate breakfast on the deck. The kitchen was furnished nicely with dishes and cookware. The full size washer and dryer were really nice. We would advise a condo on the main level or higher for views of the lake. We were in building 13 and had great views. The desk personnel were so nice an helpful. We will be coming back next year!

Reviews.Title: “Great!”
Reviews.Author: staciet77
Reviews.Content: We loved this property! The rooms were very clean and up to date. Kitchens/Rooms contained everything necessary to cook and stay the week. We enjoyed the view, the secluded area, and quiet area. Very family friendly with indoor/outdoor pool, playground, and basketball area. We will definitely stay at this property again!!

Reviews.Title: “Quiet and Restful”
Reviews.Author: Glen F
Reviews.Content: Great place to kick back and relax. Beautiful views and quite surroundings made it the perfect location to get away from it all. This was our second time in these units and loved it, again. We will definitely be back and with family next time. Plenty of space to enjoy a family and lots of ammenities.

Reviews.Title: “Always great!”
Reviews.Author: Scott M
Reviews.Content: We have been here a few times and will continue to return. Having stayed several places on Indian Point, we find this to be the best value for a resort of this type in the area. Great units, great views, great amenities, nice staff. No need to look any further.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Branson”
Reviews.Author: Audrey H
Reviews.Content: This vacation, the first we have had in a long time, was very good. We love Branson! Shopping was incredible, shows were great, especially the Oak Ridge Boys! We will be planning another soon.

Reviews.Title: “Just what we needed!”
Reviews.Author: B R
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our second visit to The Village at Indian Point. We have enjoyed both of our trips very much. There were six of us in the condo (four adults, a three year old, and a five year old) and we felt that we had everything we needed. We LOVE the indoor pools, the games they have available to borrow in the office, and the views from the condos. A perfect place for a nice getaway to Branson. Not too far from town, and very close to one of my favorite places on earth - Silver Dollar City.

Reviews.Title: “Beyond Wow!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Kathy W
